amendment.description: Amendment requires private groups receiving Federal funds (other than State, local, and tribal governments) to disclose the amount and grantee identification number of each Federal grant received; and to make a good faith estimate of their organization's actual expenditures for lobbying activities for the most recent taxable year.
amendment.purpose: An amendment, printed as amendment No. 2 in House Report 104-474, to require any private organazations that receives a Federal grant to disclose their lobbying activities to the Agency or Agencies which awarded the grant.

vote.text: On agreeing to the Istook amendment (A002) Agreed to by recorded vote: 211 - 209 (Roll no. 52).
